main event: On August 24, 1952, in Hermanas, New Mexico, the military reported a UFO sighting involving 2 unknown flying objects observed for 3 minutes and classified as unknown.
interesting points: The objects were initially seen as silver balls about 6 feet in diameter before changing shape into long gray objects and disappearing in 3 minutes.
The objects reappeared after 7 minutes and exhibited unusual maneuvers, with one climbing rapidly and the other joining it in close formation.
The observed speed of the objects was much greater than the 550 MPH indicated air speed of the observer, suggesting capabilities greater than any known aircraft.
No visible means of propulsion or sound was observed, and the Air Technical Intelligence Center could not identify any known objects in the vicinity.
The conclusion of the report was 'Unknown', indicating that the observed flight capabilities of the objects were unexplainable.
witnesses: Military personnel, including Air Force colonel Gerald W. Johnson
